qas.question: What Operation was initiated after the successful Operation Roundup?
What the the goal of the operation that followed Operation Roundup?

answers.text: to kill as many KPA and PVA troops as possible

qas.question: What signified the end of Operation Killer?
How many times was Seoul captured in a year?

answers.text: This was the city's fourth conquest

qas.question: Other than the drastic decrease in population, what other issue did the people in Seoul face?

context: In the last two weeks of February 1951, Operation Roundup was followed by <a0_0>Operation Killer<a0_0/>, carried out by the revitalized Eighth Army. It was a full-scale, battlefront-length attack staged for maximum exploitation of firepower <a1_0>to kill as many KPA and PVA troops as possible<a1_0/>. Operation Killer concluded with I Corps re-occupying the territory south of the Han River, and IX Corps <a2_0>capturing Hoengseong<a2_0/>. On 7 March 1951, the Eighth Army attacked with Operation Ripper, expelling the PVA and the KPA from Seoul on 14 March 1951. <a3_0>This was the city's fourth conquest<a3_0/> in a years' time, leaving it a ruin; the 1.5 million pre-war population was down to 200,000, and people were suffering from <a4_0>severe food shortages<a4_0/>.
